DOCNAME: JAKIMOVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a citizen of the former GPE who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE , in the former GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the ORG Chief Commander drew up a list of candidates ( army officers ) ( “ the list ” ) eligible to be granted a tenancy of a limited number of army apartments for the purpose of acquiring property . The applicant , an ORG officer , was one of the candidates who applied for an apartment .

On DATE the applicant objected to the results and the list . He complained that according to the criteria , as specified by the relevant Rules ( PERSON за условите и начинот на решавање на станбените прашања на вработените во PERSON за одбрана , воените старешини и граѓанските лица на служба во Армијата на Република Македонија ) ( “ the Rules ” ) , he should have been ranked higher and accordingly been granted a tenancy of an apartment instead of some of the other army officers . His complaint was dismissed by the ORG Chief Commander on DATE . Meanwhile , in DATE other members of the armed forces ( Mr GPE , Mr GPE and Mr GPE ) were granted tenancies by the ORG Chief Commander .

On DATE the applicant brought a civil action against ORG ( “ the Ministry ” ) for the annulment of the list and the ORG Chief Commander ’s decisions granting tenancies to PERSON , PERSON and Mr D.Z. It was followed by a request for an interim order to prohibit the ORG from concluding a sales agreement concerning the apartments granted to his colleagues .

On DATE the then ORG ( PERSON суд GPE ) requested the applicant to clarify his claim . On DATE the applicant submitted to the court the required information ( he inter alia , extended his claim to Mr V.V. , Mr ORG and Mr GPE ) .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for an interim order .
On DATE the applicant appealed against the decision .
On DATE the then ORG ( NORP суд GPE ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the lower court ’s decision .

On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s claim on the merits . It established that the applicant had been an army officer since DATE , i.e. a major and that he had applied for an army apartment . The apartments were part of the ORG ’s housing fund scheduled for sale . The court found that there had been no procedural violation of the Rules and that it had not been necessary to announce the provision of the apartments . It held that Mr GPE and Mr D.Z. had been correctly given a priority in respect to the applicant .
On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the lower court ’s decision .
On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG an appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law . It found no grounds to depart from the legal reasoning of the lower courts that domestic law had been correctly implemented and that the apartments had been granted in compliance with the relevant Rules . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a separate set of proceedings , in DATE the ORG brought criminal charges for forgery against Mr D.Z. , CARDINAL of the successful candidates who had been granted tenancy of an apartment . On DATE the public prosecutor rejected them as the charges did not concern an offence that could be prosecuted ex officio .
On DATE the ORG again brought criminal charges for forgery against Mr D.Z. On DATE the public prosecutor rejected the ORG ’s criminal complaint as time - barred .
On DATE the applicant brought separate criminal charges for forgery against Mr D.Z. On DATE the public prosecutor lodged an indictment against him before ORG .
On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the charges and acquitted the accused . It appears that the applicant did not appeal this decision .
